name: Residence Inn Denver Downtown

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one month and on the 9th day of my stay, I woke up with bed bug bites all over my body, including my face and neck. I went into work (at a dermatology clinic) that day and asked some of the residents to confirm that the lesions did indeed resemble insect bites. When I got home that day, I removed the sheets from my bed and saw a bed bug (I knew it was a bed bug since I am in medical school and I have studied pictures of bed bugs). I asked to change rooms and I received no apology and had to move rooms by myself. I left the pillow I had brought from home in the first room since it could have been infested, but the next day after I get back from washing all of my clothes, I found it in my new room - the staff had brought it to me even after they should have known the other room was infested. I woke up in my new room with more bites and I had to move rooms again. After all of this, the hotel still denies that there are bed bugs in the hotel and refuses to even compensate me for my dry cleaning bill (which was necessary to prevent the bugs from coming home with me in any potentially infested clothing). They disrespected me in front of other guests and insinuated that I was making the whole thing up despite the blistering red welts all over my arms, hands, face and neck. There is a fundamental lack of knowledge and respect for the decency of a fellow human-being by every staff member I encountered while at this hotel.
reviews.title: This Place Has Bed Bugs - Stay Away!!!

reviews.text: Can't possibly say enough positive things about this hotel. Every one of their staff we came in contact with was exceptional. Couldn't believe the free drink and 'dinner' offered during the weeknights. Excellant b'fast each morning with a lovely setting. Bartender Kelly was awesome! Beautiful suites...Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else while in Denver.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and staff with a perfect location.

reviews.text: We just recently go back from a trip to Denver and this was the hotel we choose because of the location. Neither my husband or myself had ever been to Denver so we were not really sure of the proximity of this Hotel to things we wanted to do. But as it was it turned out to be FANTASTIC! It was close enough to downtown where we went to the Art Museum to see the King Tut Exhibit and to Elitch Gardens and way easy to get on the I 25 for our day out of the city to Garden of the Gods and The Royal Gorge Bridge. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone needing to stay in the Downtown Denver area. And we will stay again in this hotel for sure. Staff was great as was the breakfast and the room size was awsome and we only had the large studio can't imagine if we had a bigger room.
reviews.title: Great Location!!

reviews.text: We were a large group of families attending an event in Denver. This is one of the few hotels we were able to find that would accommodate comfortably 5 people in a room. Residence Inn turned out to be the best value. Clean, quiet, and comfortable, we we made use of the kitchen facilities in our down time. The complimentary full breakfast was much better than expected, and so convenient. We also made use of the free shuttle service even though the "center" of the city where other family members were staying was only about 1 3/4 miles away. We walked a few times, and that was not a bad walk either. We were also glad that parking was free--which it would not have been if we had stayed at some of the center high rise hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect for us!

reviews.text: I've probably spent 75 nights in this hotel in the last four years. It has a good location, is an attractive and comfortable property, and the staff are generally pleasant. The lady who runs the afternoon hospitality session, Kelly, makes an exceptional effort.
reviews.title: Still Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a downstairs room because we didn't want to lug our luggage up stairs. Still had to go up some stairs. Couldn't sleep because of pounding from children jumping above us. Called front desk and eventually (requiring second call) someone checked it out. Jumping stopped, but ordinary footsteps were still loud. They moved us after the third call. If you want to stay at this hotel, I suggest upper floor and treading very lightly in your stockings or bare feet so you don't disturb your downstairs neighbors.
reviews.title: Awakened by footsteps from occupants in room above.

reviews.text: There was no ice in the refrigerator when we went into the first room, and no ice when we went into the second. No directions to an ice machine on the premises. We had to go to the front desk and beg some.
reviews.title: Kept awake by air-conditioner and occupants of the room above.

reviews.text: The airconditioner is very noisy and the internal soundproofing of the rooms is bad. When the person from the room above walks around or flushes the toilet you hear the sound transmits straight through to the room below. Other than that the hotel is good. Friendly and helpful staff. Internet speed is not great.
reviews.title: reasonable stay

reviews.text: Located just outside the city center, the hotel is reasonable good considering the pricing... it also provides shuttle service to the city and they also do the pick-up when you are finished... Rooms are spacious with a kitchen with all utensils..
reviews.title: Impossible to Work Out Here

reviews.text: Ample parking space * Free internet (not fast through) are its salient features..
reviews.title: Home Away From Home!

reviews.text: Typical Residence Inn property: lots of families, nice breakfast, rooms clean comfortable but getting a little worn. Friendly lobby and breakfast room staff. Shuttle (limited to 14 - first come, first served) to downtown is convenient and picks you up pretty much anywhere. This is a GREAT location if you are planning to attend a Rockies game. Excellent nightly price for an extremely comfortable family stay.
reviews.title: Great location for Downtown activities

reviews.text: We stayed just one night with dog and 3 kids (11,13,13). Like most residence inns. We drove downtown in just 5 mins and parked near 16th street for dinner. Would be easier if you stayed downtown, but this hotel allows pets and has the space for 5 people. This is the third time I've stayed here and would stay again if with kids/dog.
reviews.title: Very close to downtown for large family but need car/shuttle

reviews.text: This hotel is an extended-stay hotel. We had a queen one room suite with a full kitchen, large bathroom, seating area. A full breakfast was included as well as free internet. It also had free parking right outside our room. It is within walking distance of 16th St. Mall and other downtown attractions. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Convenient and spacious

reviews.text: This "SO CALLED" Hotel was the WORST STAYI have had in 20+ years- NOISY - NOISY - could not sleep and the response sucked big time from the front desk - -and believe me this in being the "worst" experience I have encountered- avoid at all cost - I would sleep in my car first - !!!!
reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS - TERRIBLE HOTEL AND STAY

reviews.text: The Residence Inn worked out well for me during my stay. Nice happy hour and good breakfast. The room itself was more than adequate for my needs. Wireless internet, TV, refrigerator, and plenty of room to spread out. As others have mentioned, you can definitely hear noises from the rooms above you. For me it wasn't a problem, but I can see how it might be.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel. Would stay again.

reviews.text: This Residence Inn is one of the old style with the studios downstairs and the penthouses upstairs. It is very well maintained. The rooms are predictably spacious and comfortable. The location is most excellent - just a minute or two from downtown Denver and just a few seconds off I-25. It is convenient and quiet. What more could you want?
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location.

reviews.text: We were welcomed with open arms by the front desk persoonel as soon as we walked through the front door. We arrived earlier than the normal check in time and were shown our room immediately. We even got some free drink tickets for the Rock Bottom Brewery around the corner. The fitness center was great, hot breakfast each morning and dinner in the evenings. The hotel is located right off the 16th Street Mall so you are close to everything downtown. We had four adults (two couples). The problem was that one couple got the bedroom and the other couple got a crappy old fold out couch that extended out to the tv stand so the person on the far side had to crawl over the bed to get to the rest of the room. Sleeping on the bed wasn't the least bit comfortable. The other problem with the room was that the bathroom was IN the bedroom--the sink part at least. Try brushing your teeth with another couple in their pj's lying on the bed. The toilet and shower stall were in their own room but you had to walk through the bedroom to get there. Try holding your bladder all night after a certain age. For a family, it would have been all right but it was uncomfortable for two couples. Every staff member really seemed to enjoy working there and were very knowledgeable.
reviews.title: Great amenities but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Old hotel, I could hear every footstep from neighbor upstairs and noise from parking lot made for poor sleep. Large efficiency room with kitchen and sitting area.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else, poor quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in a studio suite with king bed in November at this Residence Inn. It was booked on the Marriott website. Total cost including taxes came to about $113 per night.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Summary: Pros:
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location for the price

description: Residence Inn by Marriott Denver Downtown hotel is a residential style apartment hotel located at I-25 and Speer in metropolitan Denver. Our spacious suites feature a fully equipped kitchen, living area with sofa, and an ergonomic desk and chair. All guests are treated to a complimentary hot breakfast buffet, social hour Mon-Wed, and wireless high-speed Internet access. The hotel is close to all of Denver's major league sports venues-Invesco Field, Pepsi Center and Coors Field-just a short complimentary shuttle ride away. The Colorado Convention Center is 1.5 miles away. The University of Colorado at Denver, Metro State and Regis University are nearby. Cultural attractions near the hotel include Denver Art Museum, Denver Performing Arts Center, Downtown Aquarium, and Children's Museum of Denver.
